description: Indiana Fever guard Sophie Cunningham humorously declared teammate Caitlin Clark would be her last choice to manage her social media, calling her a "shit starter." This lighthearted jab highlights their strong off-court bond as both players recover from season-ending injuries. Cunningham has consistently defended Clark's significant impact on the WNBA's popularity.

Ashes down under: First since 1982 - Why Gabba will not host first Test of series?
description: The Ashes series opener moves from Brisbane's Gabba for the first time since 1982, with Perth Stadium hosting the first Test. This shift, driven by commercial decisions and scheduling, marks a departure from the Gabba's historical dominance, especially against England. The series will then proceed to Brisbane for a day-night Test.

description: A widespread internet disruption is affecting popular platforms like X and ChatGPT due to issues with Cloudflare, a major content delivery network provider. Users are encountering error messages and are unable to access various websites and online services. The problems began this morning and are directly linked to Cloudflare's system malfunctions.

This decision comes despite the Commanders' losing streak and their starting quarterback's injury. Broadcast protection rules and network priorities prevented a schedule change. Fans expected a more competitive matchup, but league decisions remained unchanged.

Jaishankar highlighted India's right to defend its people against terrorism.

description: India's women's cricket series against Bangladesh, slated for next month, has been postponed by the BCCI. The board is actively seeking an alternative opponent for December. This development follows diplomatic tensions between the two nations, though not officially confirmed as the reason for the postponement. The team awaits a new schedule before the WPL and a subsequent tour of Australia.

description: President Trump explained his hoarse voice stemmed from arguing with individuals he deemed "stupid" about trade and tariff policies. He admitted to "blowing his stack" during discussions with an unnamed country attempting to renegotiate a trade deal, a move that has become a central point of his economic agenda amidst a Supreme Court review of his emergency powers.

What US numbers and India’s rise tell us about American dream
description: Open Doors 2025 shows a sharp shift in US international education. Total international students hit 1.17 million, but new arrivals are down and enrolled classroom numbers are flat. Growth is now driven by OPT and post-study work, not fresh enrolment. India leads this transition as the top sender, powering STEM, OPT and the new version of the American dream.

title: Delhi blast: Cong MP's 'misguided' remark sparks fury; BJP calls him 'spin doctor'
description: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla criticized Congress MP Imran Masood for calling suicide bomber Umar Un Nabi a "misguided youth." Poonawalla accused the Congress of prioritizing vote bank politics over national interest, citing past instances where opposition leaders allegedly downplayed terror acts. The remarks came after a video emerged of the bomber justifying his actions.

title: Who Is Girlalala? TikTok star shot as boyfriend Shanoyd Whyte is arrested
description: Popular TikToker Girlalala, real name Maurice Jaden Harrison, has died. She was shot inside her apartment. Her boyfriend, Shanoyd Whyte, has been arrested and charged with murder. The couple had a history of domestic issues documented online. This tragic event has sparked reactions from fans and celebrities, highlighting the dangers of domestic violence.

description: Mid-career professionals in their 40s are facing increasing layoffs, impacting their identity and confidence. Laura Zimmermaker's experience highlights the importance of reclaiming professional identity, rebuilding narratives with intention, and learning to articulate one's story with confidence. Treating rejection as information and building alternative paths can lead to reinvention and autonomy.

Delhi 2020 riots 'attack on sovereignty': Cops oppose Umar Khalid's bail in SC
description: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told the Supreme Court that the 2020 Delhi riots were a pre-planned attempt to divide society communally, not a spontaneous protest. He argued accused activists are responsible for trial delays. Meanwhile, the Delhi high court directed police to update on riot investigations, noting petitions have been pending for six years without pursuing alternate legal remedies.

title: Babar Azam slapped with heavy fine; ICC punish batter for code of conduct breach
description: Pakistan captain Babar Azam faced a penalty from the ICC, receiving a 10% match fee fine for a Code of Conduct breach.  The incident involved him striking the stumps with his bat after being dismissed in the third ODI against Sri Lanka. This marks his first offense in two years, resulting in a demerit point.

Busting myths: H-1B workers are not 'cheap labour'; why they are important for US
description: A National Foundation for American Policy report argues that H-1B visa restrictions, including a new $100,000 fee, are counterproductive. The report highlights that H-1B holders are highly skilled professionals earning substantial salaries, not cheap labor, and that limiting these visas could drive jobs and innovation abroad.

title: Chop, change and crumble: How Gambhir’s Test tactics are hurting India at home
description: While he has been spot-on in limited-overs formats, the head coach's red-ball stint has been marked by a stubborn preference for underprepared tracks, which have put India's batters at a disadvantage. The constant chopping & changing also seems to have led to declining results.

title: NBA trade rumor: Rockets eye $118M Mavericks star in blockbuster deal
description: Houston Rockets, surprisingly strong early, are exploring a blockbuster trade for Kyrie Irving to fill the void left by Fred VanVleet's season-ending injury. This move would reunite Irving with Kevin Durant, a partnership that previously generated significant excitement. The proposed deal involves trading VanVleet and Dorian Finney-Smith for Irving, offering Houston a veteran playmaker and elite scorer.

title: Death penalty for Hasina: Dhaka wants her back; can India refuse extradition?
description: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina was sentenced to death in absentia for the 2024 student crackdown, a verdict she called a foregone conclusion. India responded cautiously, acknowledging the verdict and reiterating its commitment to Bangladesh's peace and stability, while remaining non-committal on extradition requests.

title: Trey Benson injury update: Cardinals coach assesses recovery amid slump
description: Arizona Cardinals running back Trey Benson, who replaced an injured James Conner, is sidelined with a brutal knee injury sustained in Week 5. Despite initial hopes for a Week 10 return, his recovery timeline remains unclear. Head coach Jonathan Gannon stated Benson is progressing but not yet ready to play, marking his sixth missed game.

title: 5 common medicines that can damage kidneys and what are the alternatives
description: Millions in India face chronic kidney disease, with drug-induced damage a significant concern. Common medications like NSAIDs, antibiotics, and contrast agents can harm kidneys, especially with long-term use or in vulnerable individuals. Understanding these risks and consulting doctors is crucial for prevention.
